DataElement.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Tract Past Week Frequency of Diarrhea Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the frequency of loose or liquid stools occurring during the past week.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Tract Past Week How Often Diarrhea
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff._The most recent week, including today._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._Watery bowel movements.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.value: Received intravenous or extra fluids during the past week to prevent or treat fluid loss from diarrhea

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.: Exceeding the normal or usual number.: A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A sterile liquid preparation infused into a vein.  IV fluid is prescribed as a replacement of fluid, electrolytes, calories, vitamins, and other nutritional substances.  In addition, IV fluids are used to administer blood products and medications such as chemotherapy.  Examples of IV fluids include Normal Saline, Ringers Solution, and Lactated Ringers Solution. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.
Exceeding the normal or usual number.

A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A sterile liquid preparation infused into a vein.  IV fluid is prescribed as a replacement of fluid, electrolytes, calories, vitamins, and other nutritional substances.  In addition, IV fluids are used to administer blood products and medications such as chemotherapy.  Examples of IV fluids include Normal Saline, Ringers Solution, and Lactated Ringers Solution. (NCI)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency bordering on daily.
